newsitem.title: AUSTRALIA: RTRS-Reith confident on Canberra's labour reforms.
newsitem.headline: RTRS-Reith confident on Canberra's labour reforms.

text.p: Australian Industrial Relations Minister Peter Reith said on Tuesday he was confident the government would get its industrial relations reforms through the upper house of parliament, which it does not control.

"I am confident that when the Democrats say that they will support the legislation with amendments that that will happen, and that that will happen this year and we'll start next year with a new system," Reith said.
The government is two votes short of a majority in the Senate.
The Democrats are the only realistic source of support for the reforms, which would promote work contracts directly between workers and employers, without unions or labour tribunals.
Earlier on Tuesday, Independent senator Mal Colston said he would not vote for the reforms, but Alston said he was not surprised.
"He wrote to me about a week ago telling me he wouldn't be voting for the industrial relations reforms, so it was no surprise for him to say it this morning."
